title: Real Housewives of Orange County star Gina Kirschenheiter opens up about her 'disaster' situation
text:
Real Housewives of Orange County star Gina Kirschenheiter opened up about her relationship with estranged husband Matt Kirschenheiter.

The 35 year old reality star appeared on Bravo's Watch What Happens Live, where she was asked by host Andy Cohen how she's been doing 'co-parenting.'

While she wouldn't go into specifics, she did mention her relationship with her ex is a, 'disaster of a situation.'

Estranged: Real Housewives of Orange County star Gina Kirschenheiter opened up about her relationship with estranged husband Matt Kirschenheiter

'It's, um, it's going, We are doing that. We communicate on Talking Parents, which is like a government website, which I think is really healthy for us right now,' she said.

'And we communicate about the kids and for the kids. I mean, I have to say, for such a disaster of a situation, I actually think it's probably okay, as best as it can be.'

Her estranged husband was arrested on June 22 on domestic violence charges, and while he was released the next day, Gina filed a restraining order against him, preventing him from being 100 feet from her.

Communicate: 'It's, um, it's going, We are doing that. We communicate on Talking Parents, which is like a government website, which I think is really healthy for us right now,' she said

The official charged revealed Matt, 'willfully and unlawfully inflicted corporal injury resulting in a traumatic condition upon' Gina.

Gina's estranged husband is allowed to see his children with Gina — daughter Sienna, five, and sons Nicholas, seven, and Luca, four.

They did come to a custody agreement during their divorce proceedings in July, though Gina hasn't spoken much about the incident, understandably so.

Kids: Gina's estranged husband is allowed to see his children with Gina — daughter Sienna, five, and sons Nicholas, seven, and Luca, four

Kirschenheiter also was asked by a caller about how she felt when her co-star Kelly Dodd mentioned that her children 'run amok' in a confessional.

'I was really upset about that,' Gina replied. 'I feel like there's lines that you don't cross, and definitely children are one of them.

'Usually with Kelly, the things that she says, she doesn't even know what she's saying, and I think this is one of those times,' she added.

Rumor: Kirschenheiter also was asked by a caller about how she felt when her co-star Kelly Dodd mentioned that her children 'run amok' in a confessional

'She did text me and apologize, and she did mean it,' Gina added. 'I could tell in her text that she meant it.

'She understood she crossed the line, which actually for Kelly I think is actually a really good thing. I wish she would do that more, honestly,' Gina added.

The Real Housewives of Orange County continues its 14th season on Tuesday, October 8 on Bravo.
